article.description: Justin Alston scored 16 points and Boston University used a big second half to pull away from Maine 102-78 on Saturday at BU's Steve Wright Classic tournament.
article.headline: Alston, Mosely help lift BU over Maine 102-78
article.linkText: Alston, Mosely help lift BU over Maine 102-78
article.story:
BOSTON -- Justin Alston scored 16 points, Cheddi Mosely added 15 and made four assists and Boston University used a big second half to pull away from Maine 102-78 on Saturday at BU's Steve Wright Classic tournament.

Eric Fanning scored 14 points for the Terriers (2-1) and Destin Barnes added 10. The Terriers scored 21 points off of 13 Black Bears turnovers and made 12 of 27 3-pointers (44 percent).

There were five lead changes and the Black Bears led by as many as six points before Fanning made a 3-point play to spark an 8-0 Boston University run and the Terriers took a 43-30 halftime lead.

Boston University pulled steadily away in the second half on 68.9 percent shooting (20 of 29). Will Goff's 3-pointer with six minutes left put the Terriers up by 34 points, their largest lead of the game.

Andrew Fleming led Maine (1-2) with 17 points.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
